title: 2025 Ohio State and Miami, Meet 2002 Ohio State and Miami
description: Stop me if you‚Äôve heard this before‚Ä¶ Two blue-blood college football programs with a rich history of national championships are set to square off, but the past few years have been much kinder to one team than the other. One team is the defending national champion, the previous year having ended its relatively brief national [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Stop me if you‚Äôve heard this before‚Ä¶

Two blue-blood college football programs with a rich history of national championships are set to square off, but the past few years have been much kinder to one team than the other.

One team is the defending national champion, the previous year having ended its relatively brief national title drought by thoroughly dominating a fellow, one-loss blue blood program in the championship game. This program last won a national title a decade prior, so the gap between titles had become uncomfortably long for this program‚Äôs fanbase. Of course, the previous year‚Äôs title game wasn‚Äôt nearly as close as the final score suggests. The now-defending champs raced out to a multi-touchdown lead by halftime, and lead 20+ points in the third quarter.

Although the defending champs lost quite a bit of a talent to the NFL, including multiple first round draft picks in the previous year‚Äôs draft, this team is still stacked with future-NFL talent up and the down the roster. This team‚Äôs star safety and stable of future-pro wide receivers are particularly problematic for their opponents. The quarterback is also a Heisman finalist. Nearly every pundit in the nation believes this is the most talented team in the country, and nobody is expecting this team to lose.

On the other side of the field is the underdog. A talented team in its own right that is coming out of a long rebuild ‚Äì the previous three years saw this team go a combined 21-15. But signs of progress are there. At the helm is a former offensive assistant who returned to helm this program 16 years later after building his head coaching experience. This team‚Äôs relatively new coach is a particularly strong recruiter, and this program is coming off multiple Top 10 ranked recruiting classes. Signs of emergence really started to show once this program was able to consistently beat its rivals, even though those wins did not necessarily translate to conference or national titles.

This season, the underdog built its reputation on defense. No team managed to score in the 30‚Äôs, including its premier non-conference opponent ‚Äì a top 10 team that itself had national title aspirations, but finished its season with two losses and on the outside looking in. In fact, the offense looked so anemic at times that this team won a road game despite scoring just 10 points. So defense is definitely this team‚Äôs calling card, but the offense‚Äôs best weapon is a freshman stud who was the conference‚Äôs freshman of the year.

The ‚Äúunderdog‚Äù is both 2025 Miami and 2002 Ohio State:

Ohio State was a combined 21-15 from 1999 to 2001. Miami was a nearly identical 22-16 from 2022-2024.

Despite the mediocre record, Ohio State was coming off back-to-back wins over arch-rival Michigan in 2001 and 2002. Despite the mediocre record, Miami was coming off back-to-back wins over arch-rival Florida State in 2024 and 2025.

The premiere non-conference win for 2002 Ohio State was 25-7 at home against Washington St., which finished the regular season with two losses and ranked No. 10 in the AP Poll. The premiere non-conference win for 2025 Miami was 27-24 at home against Notre Dame, which finished the regular season with two losses and ranked No. 9 in the AP Poll.

Head Coach Jim Tressell was an assistant offensive coach for Ohio State from 1983 to 1985 before returning to Ohio State 16 years later in 2001. Head Coach Mario Cristobal was an assistant offensive coach for Miami from 2004 to 2006 before returning to Miami 16 years later in 2022.

According to 247Sports, the Buckeyes had top ten recruiting classes in 2000 and 2001 (No. 6 and 9). The Hurricanes had top ten recruiting classes in 2023 and 2024 (No. 7 and 4).

The 2002 Ohio State Buckeyes typically held teams to under 20 points, never allowing a team to score 30, which was necessary considering how anemic their offense was at times. The 2025 Miami Hurricanes typically held teams under 20 points, never allowing a team to score 30, which was necessary considering how anemic their offense was at times.

2002 Ohio State‚Äôs best offensive weapon was true freshman RB Maurice Clarett, that season‚Äôs Big Ten Freshman of the Year. 2025 Miami‚Äôs best offensive weapon is true freshman WR Malachi Toney, this season‚Äôs ACC Freshman of the Year.

The ‚Äúdefending champion‚Äù is both 2002 Miami and 2025 Ohio State:

Ohio State won the 2024 national title, beating blue-blood Notre Dame in a game that was 31-7 in the 3rd Quarter. Miami won the 2001 national title, beating blue-blood Nebraska in a game that was 34-0 at halftime.

Ohio State last won a national title a decade prior in 2014. Miami last won a national title a decade prior in 1991.

Following their 2024 title run, in the 2025 NFL Draft the Buckeyes had 4 first round selections (WR Emeka Egbuka, G Donovan Jackson, DT Tyliek Williams, and DT Josh Simmons) plus another 3 second round selections (RB Quinshon Judkins, RB TreVeyon Henderson, and DE JT Tuimoloau). In the 2002 NFL Draft, the Hurricanes had 5 first round selections (OT Bryan McKinnie, TE Jeremy Shockey, CB Philip Buchanon, FS Ed Reed, and CB Mike Rumph) plus another second round selection (RB Clinton Portis).

The 2025 Ohio State Buckeyes are led by Heisman Finalist, QB Julian Sayin. The 2002 Miami Hurricanes were led by Heisman Finalist, QB Ken Dorsey.

Arguably 2025 Ohio State‚Äôs best offensive weapons were receivers for their Heisman Finalist quarterback, namely WRs Jeremiah Smith, Carnell Tate, and Brandon Inniss. Arguably 2002 Miami‚Äôs best offensive weapons were receivers for their Heisman Finalist quarterback, namely WRs Andre Johnson and Roscoe Parrish plus TE Kellen Winslow, Jr.

Arguably 2025 Ohio State‚Äôs defensive leaders are S Caleb Downs and LB Arvell Reese. Arguably 2002 Miami‚Äôs defensive leaders were S Sean Taylor and LB Jonathan Vilma.

It‚Äôs like looking into a mirror a quarter-of-a-century apart. For ‚ÄòCanes fans, hopefully history repeats itself.

title: What has been the most encouraging part of the 2025 Lions season?
description: 2025 was a failure for the Detroit Lions, but there were still some encouraging parts.
fullText:
In a season unanimously viewed as a failure, there are many parts of the 2025 Detroit Lions that can be considered disappointing. Whether it is the continued onslaught of injuries, the regression from the offense, the struggles of the defense, or the inability to reach the playoffs‚Äîlet alone compete for a Super Bowl‚Äîa lot went wrong for Detroit. Yet with one game left to play before the book closes on the season, can we acknowledge some positive moments?

Many will fall into the ‚Äúnothing can be viewed positively since they missed the playoffs‚Äù camp. While it is understandable to judge a season in a black and white way, either success or failure, the truth of the matter is that the Lions are not staring down the barrel of a total rebuild‚Äîthey can expect tough questions with tough answers, sure, but not a total rebuild. The core of the team is still intact, and it‚Äôs not hard to envision a rebound next season.

Today‚Äôs Question of the Day is:

My answer: Jack Campbell‚Äôs breakout.

There are a lot of honorable mentions for this discussion. Jahmyr Gibbs showcased an elite skill set‚Äîwhen the blocking held up. Jameson Williams had some duds, but he nonetheless put together another 1,000-yard season, all while growing as a route runner. Al-Quadin Muhammad proved that his late 2024 tear was not a fluke with over 10 sacks in 2025, albeit in limited snaps‚Äîperhaps too limited. Thomas Harper proved to be an excellent waiver wire claim, not only starting multiple games but playing fairly well when called upon.

However, they all pale in comparison to Campbell‚Äôs ascension. His 2023 rookie campaign was rough: the flashes of athleticism were there, but the mental game lagged far behind. In 2024, he started to put it together, looking far more comfortable as a central figure on defense. This season, Campbell has elevated his game to a Pro Bowl level and, with enough support, arguably an All-Pro level too.

He has taken significant strides in run defense and is now perhaps the best run stopping linebacker in the league (per PFF, he is first in run defense grade among linebackers). Equally impressive has been his pass rushing prowess. He is no Micah Parsons, but his blitzing ability has vastly improved over previous seasons. In the past, his blitzes were carried by his athleticism. The athleticism was still present in 2025, but he complemented it with a knack for finding the right lane to exploit. He presently has five sacks on the season, third on the team behind Aidan Hutchinson (13.5) and Muhammad (11.0). While this might say a lot about the Lions‚Äô pass rush, that should not discount the role Campbell has played.

Campbell is second in the NFL in tackles, and he has earned every single one of them. For as bad as the Lions were in 2025, Campbell was a bright spot nearly every week.

title: What was behind Enea Bastianini's worst season in MotoGP?
description: Switching from Ducati to KTM was ‚Äúclose to a shock‚Äù for the seven-time grand prix winner Bastianini
fullText:
Enea Bastianini has offered insight into why he struggled to such an extent during a wretched first season on KTM‚Äôs MotoGP bike in 2025.

Bastianini moved to Tech3 this year on a factory-spec bike, partnering Maverick Vinales in an all-new line-up at KTM‚Äôs secondary squad.

But from his first test with the Austrian marque in Valencia 2024, it was clear that the RC16 was not playing to his strength - and a crash in which he completely wrecked his bike only reinforced that impression.

Problems persisted when the season kicked off in March, leaving Bastianini in the shadows of his new team-mate Vinales, who impressed with his adaptation to the RC16. Across the opening 10 rounds and before Vinales broke his shoulder at the Sachsenring, Bastianini managed just 42 points compared to 69 for the former.

There was a ray of hope that the Italian had turned around his campaign when he qualified fourth in Hungary and followed that up with a podium in Barcelona, but it ultimately amounted to little more than a brief respite.

He eventually ended the season a distant 14th in the standings, scoring just over a third of the points Pedro Acosta accumulated on the factory KTM (112 points vs 307).

It was a far cry from the heights Bastianini reached just last season, when he guided his works Ducati GP24 to two victories and seven other grand prix podiums.

In fact, this was easily the worst season of his MotoGP career; even in his rookie season in 2021, he managed to finish 11th in the championship and score 102 points from 18 rounds at a time when there were no sprint races.

Bastianini makes no secret in explaining how steep his learning curve proved after switching manufacturers for the first time in MotoGP.

‚ÄúI think the adaptation to the bike this year has been very complicated for me, starting from the first test when I jumped,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt's not been a shock, but very close to a shock because the bike was very different from the other one.

‚ÄúWhen it's like this, you have every weekend to work, to change something. Also [despite] this, we were competitive on Sundays.

‚ÄúLast year, at the end of the season, I was fast in the sprints and I was always on top. I knew how it would be and what the approach of the weekend was, but you have to be clear. This year, the situation was not clear to me.‚Äù

For much of 2025, Bastianini found himself on the back foot early in the weekend, struggling with his feeling on the bike on Fridays. While there was often clear progress overnight and into Sunday, he was frequently left with too much ground to make up.

At Valencia, for instance, the 27-year-old toiled near the back in practice and qualified only 20th. Yet his race pace was strong, allowing him to climb steadily through the field to finish a solid 10th.

‚ÄúFriday complicated, Saturday a bit less and Sunday in the race we are competitive. This happened many times. I think [it happened] every weekend, from just two or three weekends apart,‚Äù he highlighted the trend.

Bastianini‚Äôs improved pace in race trim was partly down to his increased confidence on medium tyres, which are preferred during longer grands prix. With Michelin‚Äôs soft rubber, he suffered from a phenomenon called the ‚Äòrear pushing the front‚Äô, which had a detrimental impact on his cornering ability.

‚ÄúWe are also competitive in the race because I find the confidence to be fast with the medium tyre,‚Äù he explained. ‚ÄúWhen we put a soft on the rear, the bike gives me the opposite; no confidence and I can't push.

‚Äú[With the soft tyre], the rear pushes me out in every corner and it's also much more complicated to turn. With the medium, it's much better for me to slide with the rear, I'm much more confident. Lap by lap in the race, I'm much more confident. This has happened every time.‚Äù

Bastianini was pinning his hopes on the post-season Valencia test to find a breakthrough and head to the winter break on a positive note, but after trying a variety of components in a condensed schedule, he left Spain without the answers he had been seeking.

"I still haven't cleared up all my doubts about certain things,‚Äù he conceded. ‚ÄúWe also tested two quite different bikes. The new bike had a different chassis and a few other slightly different things. But I still haven't really understood the pros and cons of both. The only thing I've understood is that the seat is much more ergonomic, anyway.

‚ÄúBut hey, I'm happier to have wrapped up 2025.‚Äù

Bastianini knows that the first pre-season test of 2025 will be important for him as he heads into the second and final year of his KTM contract.

"More than confidence, I'm leaving knowing what awaits me next year. I finished 17th [in the test], and quite far back. So I wanted to finish a bit higher up the standings, to end on a high note. But we couldn't work on the set-up.

‚ÄúTherefore, Sepang will be a crucial test for me: I'll have to work very hard and try to make the most of the three days we have.‚Äù

KTM‚Äôs 850cc engine for 2027 MotoGP season breaks cover in Jerez test

Why KTM would be wise to prepare for a future without Pedro Acosta

To read more Motorsport.com articles visit our website.

title: Arsenal 'actively looking' at January signings
description: Arsenal will be "actively looking" at potential signings during the January transfer window, says manager Mikel Arteta.
fullText:
Arsenal will be "actively looking" at potential signings during the January transfer window, says manager Mikel Arteta.

The Gunners spent about ¬£250m in the summer and brought in eight new players as they looked to increase the quality in their squad to deal with the packed fixture list and compete for trophies in multiple competitions.

Last season Arsenal's campaign was decimated by injuries.

They were without defender Gabriel Magalhaes for the final part of the season and played with midfielder Mikel Merino as a makeshift striker as they finished second in the Premier League for a third successive season and were knocked out in the semi-finals of the Champions League by Paris St-Germain.

This season the Gunners have also been plagued with injuries. They lost Kai Havertz from the opening day, while captain Martin Odegaard and Bukayo Saka, Gabriel Martinelli, Noni Madueke and Max Dowman have had spells on the sidelines.

Now, after injuries mainly affecting attacking players, it is the Arsenal backline which is suffering.

Arteta was forced to play Declan Rice in an unfamiliar right-back position against Brighton on Saturday because Jurrien Timber was injured and Riccardo Calafiori picked up an issue in the warm-up.

Gabriel returned from injury in the 2-1 win, but the return dates of Cristhian Mosquera, Timber and Calafiori are not known.

"We're going to be really aware of the situation and the timescale of certain players," Arteta said.

"We have to be actively looking, and then can we do it or not?

"That's a different story, but our job is to be always very prepared because something can happen."

Ask about Arsenal - what do you want to know?

title: Liverpool transfer news round-up: Antoine Semenyo, Marc Guehi and more after Alexander Isak injury blow
description: Arne Slot could dip into the transfer market after losing Alexander Isak to injury for the foreseeable future
fullText:
Liverpool could become major players in the January transfer market after Alexander Isak‚Äôs serious injury ruled him out for several months.

Arne Slot can at least lean on Hugo Ekitike, with the French forward settling quickly to life in the Premier League.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs going to be a long injury, for a couple of months,‚Äù Slot said of Isak, who joined the Reds from Newcastle for ¬£125m in the summer and has scored just three goals in 16 appearances in all competitions. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a big disappointment for him and, as a result, for us.‚Äù

But reinforcements could come to boost the Reds after a testing first half of the season.

Here are the latest stories surrounding the transfer market at Anfield:

Antoine Semenyo has been one of the players of the season for Bournemouth and is the main name strongly attached to the Reds so far ahead of next month‚Äôs window opening. The 25-year-old is also versatile, with an ability to play across the front line, and has scored eight goals and assisted three 

But while the Reds have registered an interest in Semenyo, Manchester City have moved ahead of Liverpool in the race to sign the Ghanaian international, with The Independent understanding City have opened talks with Bournemouth in a bid to sign the player.

Semenyo has a ¬£65m release clause in his contract with the Cherries and while a move is not yet wrapped up, Liverpool face a decision whether to trigger the release clause themselves and match City‚Äôs interest. Semenyo would like to decide upon his next club before 1 January, while his release clause is thought to expire on 10 January.

Fabrizio Romano says that Liverpool are ‚Äúopen‚Äù to strengthening the squad next month, though that is unlikely to involve Marc Guehi, having had a bid accepted before the move collapsed late in the window last summer.

The Crystal Palace star is likely to wait until next summer for a move on a free transfer, though Liverpool will still be in the race with Bayern Munich are also strongly linked.

Mohamed Salah‚Äôs future will also need to be settled, though the Egypt star will complete his time at the Afcon 2025 with the Pharaohs before returning to Anfield next month. Ibrahima Konate and Andy Robertson will similarly go into amid uncertainty, with both entering the final six months of their current contracts. Liverpool remain committed to extending Konate‚Äôs deal but will not budge from their existing wage structure, according to Sky Sports.

Brentford forward Igor Thiago, after his blazing start to the season with the Bees with 11 goals in 17 Premier League games, and PSG‚Äôs Bradley Barcola are names that have floated around recent gossip columns, though neither move has accelerated or gathered pace just yet.

Isak‚Äôs injury has also prompted reports of interest in various strikers, with PSG‚Äôs Goncalo Ramos, Juventus‚Äô Dusan Vlahovic and England international Ivan Toney named as potential short-term solutions, but nothing concrete has been established.

Meanwhile Harvey Elliott, currently struggling for game time on loan at Aston Villa, is unlikely to return to Anfield after Slot‚Äôs concise summary of the Reds‚Äôs stance.

‚ÄúNo, Harvey is an Aston Villa player and he is supposed to be going there for a season. So, questions about him, the best thing to ask is Aston Villa - they are doing really well, by the way.‚Äù

title: ESPN predicts the winner of Clemson vs Syracuse basketball ACC opener
description: Brad Brownell's Clemson Tigers head to Syracuse for its ACC basketball opener. Will the Tigers beat the Orange? Here's ESPN's prediction.
fullText:
The Clemson Tigers will look to start conference play on the right note when they face the Syracuse Orange in the teams' ACC opener Wednesday at JMA Wireless Dome in New York.

Clemson (10-3) closed out its nonconference schedule with a narrow 68-65 win over the Cincinnati Bearcats on Dec. 21 at Littlejohn Coliseum. The Tigers had a 38-18 lead at halftime but had to hold on in the second half as Cincinnati cut the lead to one in the closing seconds.

Dillon Hunter made four clutch free throws in the final seven seconds to preserve Clemson's victory.

Syracuse (9-4) will enter the game on a three-game winning streak. The Orange have won five of their last six, including a 62-60 upset of the No. 13 Tennessee Volunteers in the ACC/SEC Challenge on Dec. 2. Senior guard J.J. Starling leads Syracuse in scoring with 11.3 points per game in 11 starts.

Ahead of Clemson's ACC opener at Syracuse, ESPN Analytics has its odds for Wednesday's game.

ESPN's¬†matchup predictor, which offers a prediction model based on its college basketball power index and other variables, gives Clemson a 61.3% chance to win and Syracuse a 38.7% chance.

The Tigers are 24th in ESPN's latest BPI ratings. Clemson has a 14.9 overall BPI rating (7.3 offense, 7.6 defense). Syracuse has a 9.0 rating that's 67th in ESPN's metrics.

ESPN's BPI gives Clemson an overall record projection of 22.1-8.9 overall, including 12.1-5.9 in ACC play. Moreover, the Tigers are given a 4.6% chance to win the ACC.

Clemson's remaining strength of schedule is ranked 77th nationally by ESPN's metrics.

18. Boston College Eagles (-0.6 BPI)

17. Georgia Tech Yellow Jackets (2.1 BPI)

16. Florida State Seminoles (5.5 BPI)

15. Stanford Cardinal (6.6 BPI)

14. Virginia Tech Hokies (6.9 BPI)

13. Pittsburgh Panthers (7.8 BPI)

12. California Golden Bears (8.1 BPI)

10. Notre Dame Fighting Irish (9.7 BPI)

9. Wake Forest Demon Deacons (10.6 BPI)

6. Virginia Cavaliers (14.3 BPI)

5. North Carolina Tar Heels (14.4 BPI)

3. NC State Wolfpack (15.1 BPI)

2. Louisville Cardinals (21.2 BPI)

The College Basketball Power Index (BPI) is a measure of team strength that is meant to be the best predictor of performance going forward. BPI represents how many points above or below average a team is. Strength of Record (SOR) is a measure of team accomplishment based on how difficult a team's W-L record is to achieve. Game predictions account for opponent strength, pace of play, site, travel distance, day's rest and altitude, and are used to simulate the season 10,000 times to produce season projections. Numbers update daily."

Tipoff for Clemson-Syracuse in Week 9 of the 2025-26 men's college basketball season is 2 p.m. ET Wednesday at JMA Wireless Dome in Syracuse. The game can be seen on ESPN2. Wes Durham and Dennis Scott will have the TV call of the game.

Contact us¬†@Clemson_Wire¬†on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†for ongoing coverage of¬†Clemson Tigers¬†news and notes, plus opinions.

This article originally appeared on Clemson Wire: Clemson basketball odds of beating Syracuse in ACC opener, per ESPN

title: Patriots look to clinch AFC‚Äôs No. 1 playoff seed after being crowned division champs
description: The Patriots locked up their first division title since 2019, but there is still much left to play for in Week 18.
fullText:
Patriots fans have plenty to celebrate this Monday after New England clinched the AFC East title following a blowout win over the New York Jets and a nail-biting Bills loss to the Philadelphia Eagles in Buffalo.

BACK AT THE TOP! pic.twitter.com/gxmyr1ywTd

‚Äî z - New England Patriots (@Patriots) December 29, 2025

The moment the Patriots learned they had secured the division came as the team pulled into Gillette Stadium after their victory in New Jersey. The Bills‚Äô one-point, 13-12 loss sealed the deal for New England.

The moment we became division champs üëè pic.twitter.com/ImKStCRsjH

‚Äî z - New England Patriots (@Patriots) December 29, 2025

Second-year quarterback Drake Maye delivered a career performance, throwing five touchdown passes before exiting in the third quarter for a well-deserved rest with his team up 42-3.

The win helped the Patriots finish the regular season undefeated on the road.

‚ÄúIt comes down to unfinished business,‚Äù Maye said. ‚ÄúYou want to go 8-0 on the road. That would be something we thought would be pretty cool. In this league, it‚Äôs hard to win on the road, and we accomplished that today.‚Äù

In victory, Maye joined Tom Brady (11 times) and Drew Bledsoe (twice) as the only New England quarterbacks to reach 4,000 yards passing in a season.

‚ÄúThey don‚Äôt give me a vote,‚Äù Head coach Mike Vrabel said of the league MVP buzz around Maye. ‚ÄúBut there is nobody else we want as our quarterback.‚Äù

HATS & T-SHIRTS pic.twitter.com/bBUdcH1ya5

‚Äî z - New England Patriots (@Patriots) December 29, 2025

Vrabel praised the team‚Äôs effort but emphasized the need for continued improvement.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre really focused on trying to improve late in the year,‚Äù Vrabel said. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm just happy that everyone was able to play. We got a lot of really good efforts early on and complementary football.‚Äù

Vrabel added that preparation remains key as his team looks to claim the No. 1 seed in the AFC playoff bracket.

‚ÄúFrom the get-go, we‚Äôve tried to focus on having everybody that‚Äôs here prepare as a starter,‚Äù Vrabel said.

The Patriots will host the Miami Dolphins Sunday, Jan. 4, at 4:25 p.m. Boston 25 will air the game.

Patriots schedule update:#MIAvsNE will be played on 1/4 at 4:25 PM on FOX. pic.twitter.com/xqjz1oBjAb

‚Äî z - New England Patriots (@Patriots) December 29, 2025

While the Patriots have already locked up their first division title since 2019, there is still much left to play for. New England needs a Week 18 win and a Denver Broncos loss to get the No. 1 seed and a first-round bye in the NFL playoffs.

Both Denver and New England are 13-3, but because of their better record versus shared opponents‚Äîmost notably the Las Vegas Raiders, who defeated the Patriots early in the season‚Äîthe Broncos control their own fate and have a tiebreaker over the Patriots.

title: Watkins hoping to disappoint his family against Arsenal
description: Ollie Watkins has admitted he‚Äôs hoping to disappoint his family when Aston Villa face Arsenal on Tuesday night.Photo by Dan Mullan/Getty ImagesArsenal host Aston Villa on Tuesday, which also happens...
fullText:
Arsenal host Aston Villa on Tuesday, which also happens to be Ollie Watkins‚Äô 30th birthday.

Watkins hasn‚Äôt been in great form this season, but things have been picking up lately, particularly with the striker scoring twice in a win away to Chelsea on Saturday night.

The next game has particular significance to the player, not just because it‚Äôs against Premier League leaders Arsenal, but because Watkins‚Äô family will be there supporting the Gunners.

Far from hoping his family enjoy the game, Watkins has instead told the media he wants to send them home disappointed.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve got a lot of family coming to it that support them (Arsenal),‚Äù Watkins admitted.

‚ÄúSo they can be at the other end and hopefully watch me have the same outcome as [against Chelsea] in a couple of days.‚Äù

As mentioned, Watkins hasn‚Äôt been at his best so far in 2025/26, scoring just five goals and assisting one in 25 appearances for Villa. Yet it‚Äôs fair to say things have improve in December, with five of those six goal contributions coming in his five league games so far this month.

That includes a brace in an away win over Brighton, an assist in a home win over Manchester United, and another brace in an away win over Chelsea.

Watkins was also constantly threatening against Arsenal in Villa‚Äôs 2-1 victory in early December, despite neither scoring nor assisting and wasting a big chance when in on goal against David Raya. He‚Äôll hope to make his chances count this time around.

title: Usyk vs Wilder edges nearer as date and location details emerge
description: Oleksandr Usyk has been granted a voluntary title defence, which the unified heavyweight champion may use to face Deontay Wilder
fullText:
Oleksandr Usyk‚Äôs manager has confirmed that a fight with Deontay Wilder is ‚Äúvery likely‚Äù, while sharing details on when and where the bout could take place.

Usyk, the unified heavyweight champion, has been linked to a surprise fight with Wilder despite their contrasting form ‚Äì with the unbeaten Ukrainian twice becoming undisputed champion in the last two years, while the American is 2-4 dating back to 2020.

Usyk last fought in July, stopping Daniel Dubois to regain undisputed status at heavyweight, and he was then ordered to face WBO interim champion Joseph Parker. However, Usyk took time out to address an injury, and in the meantime, Parker was stopped by Fabio Wardley.

That seemingly set up Wardley for a shot at Usyk, but the latter vacated the official WBO belt and has been granted a voluntary title defence. It appears he will use that option to face Wilder ‚Äì one of the more-dominant heavyweights of this generation, but now a faded force, it seems.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs very likely,‚Äù Klimas told The National on Monday, ‚Äúbecause right now we‚Äôre working on it, and we‚Äôre working on some multi-fight agreement for Oleksandr.

‚ÄúAs soon as we‚Äôre going to confirm that, we‚Äôre going to jump in. And some talks already are going on with the team of Wilder. We‚Äôre looking at Las Vegas or Los Angeles, and dates are the end of April, beginning of May.

‚ÄúWilder is one of the best names Oleksandr didn‚Äôt face yet. He‚Äôs still in good shape, and he‚Äôs still a fighter, so he‚Äôs interesting. And as well, it‚Äôs the United States.‚Äù

Wilder last fought in June, stopping Tyrrell Anthony Herndon in seven rounds to bounce back from two straight losses, having been knocked out by Zhilei Zhang in 2024 and outpointed by Parker in 2023.

Previously, the 40-year-old held the WBC title from 2015 to 2020, ultimately losing it in the first of two consecutive KO defeats by Tyson Fury.

Fury held that belt until 2024, when Usyk outpointed the Briton to become undisputed heavyweight king for the first time. Usyk gave up the IBF title before outpointing Fury again, but he regained the belt from Dubois this July ‚Äì with his second KO of ‚ÄúDynamite‚Äù.

Klimas continued, ‚ÄúI cannot say that [Usyk] is not going to be fighting in the Riyadh Season,‚Äù referencing potential Saudi Arabian involvement in his next fight. ‚ÄúHe might be fighting in the Riyadh Season, but as far as right now, we don‚Äôt have any offers or anything like that from them.

‚ÄúNo, actually [it] is a different group from the United States. It‚Äôs not official yet, so I cannot tell you.‚Äù

Klimas also addressed Usyk‚Äôs future, with the former undisputed cruiserweight champion seemingly in the twilight of his career at the age of 38.

‚ÄúHe has at least two more years, as he says,‚Äù Klimas said. ‚ÄúI cannot go inside of his body, but he feels strong. It‚Äôs not time for him to hang up his gloves, and he‚Äôs ready to go.‚Äù

title: Tennis star Venus Williams marries actor and model Andrea Preti in lavish second wedding at $10 million Florida estate

title: Baht Falls Most Since May With Traders Wary of Intervention Risk
description: Thailand‚Äôs baht fell the most in seven months, with traders on alert for possible intervention by authorities after the currency capped six straight weeks of gains.
fullText: MarketsCurrenciesBy Y-Sing Liau and Masaki KondoSaveThailand‚Äôs baht fell the most in seven months, with traders on alert for possible intervention by authorities after the currency capped six straight weeks of gains.The baht depreciated as much as 1.1% to 31.394 per dollar, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. Last week, Thailand‚Äôs currency had climbed to the strongest level since March 2021, due in part to a rally in gold prices.

title: Aspen Surges Most in 25 Years on $1.6 Billion Asian Asset Sale
description: Aspen Pharmacare Holdings Ltd. rallied the most in a quarter-century after Africa‚Äôs biggest drugmaker said it will sell its assets in the Asia-Pacific region excluding China to an Australian private equity firm for 26.5 billion rand ($1.6 billion).
fullText: MarketsBy Ana MonteiroSaveAspen Pharmacare Holdings Ltd. rallied the most in a quarter-century after Africa‚Äôs biggest drugmaker said it will sell its assets in the Asia-Pacific region excluding China to an Australian private equity firm for 26.5 billion rand ($1.6 billion). The sale of the assets in Australia, Hong Kong, Malaysia, Taiwan and the Philippines to BGH Capital (Pty) Ltd. represents an enterprise value that‚Äôs about 11 times normalized earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization reported in 2025, the Durban, South Africa-based company said in a statement Monday.

title: Iron Ore Nears Best Close Since November on Year-End Metal Rally
description: Iron ore futures were set for their highest close since late November, riding a broader year-end rally in metals as traders look ahead to potential policy support from Beijing.
fullText: MarketsBy Katharine GemmellSaveIron ore futures were set for their highest close since late November, riding a broader year-end rally in metals as traders look ahead to potential policy support from Beijing.The steelmaking ingredient advanced for a third straight session in Singapore, climbing nearly 1.8% to as much as $106.55 a ton in intraday trading. In China, iron ore on the Dalian Commodity Exchange rose for a second day, gaining as much as 2.6%, the largest intraday rise since Sept. 9.

title: Mizuho CEO Eyes Corporate Banking Buildup in Europe and Asia
description: Mizuho Financial Group Inc. is bolstering efforts to expand its corporate and institutional banking business in Europe and Asia, pursuing a growth strategy that‚Äôs diverging from its Japanese peers.
fullText: IndustriesFinanceBy Taiga Uranaka and Hideki SuzukiSaveMizuho Financial Group Inc. is bolstering efforts to expand its corporate and institutional banking business in Europe and Asia, pursuing a growth strategy that‚Äôs diverging from its Japanese peers.Japan‚Äôs third-largest bank plans to replicate a US expansion of that division into these other regions, Chief Executive Officer Masahiro Kihara said in an interview.

title: Homeware Stocks Are Unlikely Winners of UK‚Äôs Weak Housing Market
description: Britain‚Äôs stagnant housing market is giving an unexpected boost to companies that sell home-improvement products.
fullText: MarketsBy Isabella WardSaveBritain‚Äôs stagnant housing market is giving an unexpected boost to companies that sell home-improvement products.B&Q owner Kingfisher Plc and Topps Tiles Plc are set for their best yearly share-price gains since the pandemic as consumers too strapped for cash to move house or undertake major renovations opt for DIY projects instead. Sofa-seller DFS Plc is poised for its strongest year since 2019, and Wickes Plc ‚Äî a major retailer of paint ‚Äî is on track for its best year since listing in 2022.

title: Rio, Fortescue Change Benchmark Used for China Iron Ore Pricing
description: Rio Tinto Group and Fortescue Ltd, two of the world‚Äôs largest iron ore producers, have switched the index they use to price shipments for the world‚Äôs largest commodities consumer, a rare change that follows public criticism of the current mechanism from state-backed buyer China Mineral Resources Group.
fullText: MarketsCommoditiesBy Alfred Cang and Katharine GemmellSaveRio Tinto Group and Fortescue Ltd, two of the world‚Äôs largest iron ore producers, have switched the index they use to price shipments for the world‚Äôs largest commodities consumer, a rare change that follows public criticism of the current mechanism from state-backed buyer China Mineral Resources Group.Both Rio and Fortescue will stop using S&P Global Energy Platts Iron Ore Index ‚Äî the industry‚Äôs seaborne benchmark ‚Äî for term contracts, according to people familiar with the matter, who cited a notice given to steel mills affiliated with CMRG. They asked not to be named as they are not authorized to speak to the media.

title: Mauritius Central Bank Chief Says Growth Shouldn‚Äôt Rely on Rates
description: The newly appointed governor of Mauritius‚Äôs central bank said that the Indian Ocean nation ‚Äî facing stubborn inflation ‚Äî cannot rely on lower interest rates to spur economic growth.
fullText: EconomicsCentral BanksBy Kamlesh BhuckorySaveThe newly appointed governor of Mauritius‚Äôs central bank said that the Indian Ocean nation ‚Äî facing stubborn inflation ‚Äî cannot rely on lower interest rates to spur economic growth. ‚ÄúThe domestic inflation outlook remains subject to upside risks, primarily originating from external sources,‚Äù Priscilla Muthoora Thakoor, who took up her post in September, said in an interview. ‚ÄúThe Monetary Policy Committee will thus remain data driven and forward looking in its approach to reviewing its policy stance.‚Äù

title: Goldman‚Äôs Hatzius and Snider on the Outlook for 2026
description: A discussion with two of the bank's top minds.
fullText:
MarketsOdd LotsBy Joe Weisenthal and Tracy AllowaySaveListen to Odd Lots on Apple Podcasts
Listen to Odd Lots on Spotify
Watch Odd Lots on YouTube
 So can this be repeated again in 2026? On this episode, we speak with two of the top minds at Goldman Sachs. Jan Hatzius is the bank's chief economist and head of research and Ben Snider is its chief US equity strategist. We review what really happened in 2025, talking about the impact of both AI and the tariffs, as well as how these factors will impact the real economy and stocks next year.

title: KKR Gets First Negotiation Rights to Take Yomeishu Private

fullText: MarketsDealsBy Taro FuseSaveUS investment firm KKR & Co. has received first negotiation rights to take Yomeishu Seizo Co. private, according to people familiar with the matter.KKR plans to finalize terms such as the purchase price and launch a tender offer in January 2026 for the Japanese herbal health tonic manufacturer, said the people, who who asked not to be identified as the information isn‚Äôt public. Yomeishu‚Äôs market value is about ¬•79 billion ($506 million), according to Bloomberg-compiled data. KKR plans to take over all the shares, the people said.

title: Vietnam State Bank Warns of Liquidity Shortages, Tariff Pressure

title: UAE Miner Axis Seeks $28.9 Billion in Guinea Bauxite Dispute

Axis said Guinea has ignored several attempts to settle the dispute.

title: Bulls Only: Every Wall Street Analyst Now Predicts a Stock Rally
description: At the big banks and the boutique investment shops, an optimistic consensus has taken hold: the US stock market will rally in 2026 for a fourth straight year, marking the longest winning streak in nearly two decades.
fullText: MarketsBy Alexandra Semenova and Sagarika JaisinghaniSaveAt the big banks and the boutique investment shops, an optimistic consensus has taken hold: the US stock market will rally in 2026 for a fourth straight year, marking the longest winning streak in nearly two decades.There‚Äôs plenty of angst about the risks to the bull run that‚Äôs pushed the S&P 500 Index up some 90% since its October 2022 low. The artificial-intelligence boom could turn to bust. The economy ‚Äî and the Federal Reserve‚Äôs interest-rate decisions ‚Äî could defy expectations. And President Donald Trump‚Äôs second year could bring even more unanticipated shocks than his first.

title: Last Bastion for Cheap Beef Fades in Latest Affordability Threat
description: Cheap beef may soon become further out of reach. Brazil, one of the world‚Äôs few remaining sources of abundant cattle, is heading into a period of shrinking supplies that could push global prices higher.
fullText: MarketsBy Dayanne SousaSaveCheap beef may soon become further out of reach. Brazil, one of the world‚Äôs few remaining sources of abundant cattle, is heading into a period of shrinking supplies that could push global prices higher.For the past two years, a surge in Brazil‚Äôs beef production helped fuel a jump in exports. That‚Äôs as ample herds drove cattle prices lower compared to other regions, and ranchers were encouraged to send more animals to slaughter. At the same time, countries such as the US struggled with high food costs, and sought out sources of cheaper beef.

title: Why Silver Price Has Been Surging Even More Than Gold
description: Gold staged a dramatic rally in 2025 as the US Trump administration‚Äôs unorthodox economic policies sent investors and central banks reaching for safe-haven assets. Right now, however, it‚Äôs silver that‚Äôs stealing the spotlight.
fullText: MarketsExplainerBy S'thembile Cele and Jack RyanSaveGold staged a dramatic rally in 2025 as the US Trump administration‚Äôs unorthodox economic policies sent investors and central banks reaching for safe-haven assets. Right now, however, it‚Äôs silver that‚Äôs stealing the spotlight. Surging investor demand collided with limited availability to catapult the price of silver above $80 a troy ounce at the end of December, almost triple its value a year earlier and enough to dwarf even gold‚Äôs meteoric rise of more than 70%.

title: European Stocks Hover at Record Highs, Ukraine Talks in Focus
description: European stocks hovered at record highs as traders monitored negotiations around a potential peace deal in Ukraine.
fullText: MarketsBy Julien PonthusSaveEuropean stocks hovered at record highs as traders monitored negotiations around a potential peace deal in Ukraine.The Stoxx Europe 600 Index ticked up 0.1% at 1:16 p.m. in Paris, after hitting a fresh peak in morning trading. Mining shares outperformed as copper surged to new records.

title: Airbus Cranks Out Aircraft at Rapid Pace to Meet Delivery Goal
description: Airbus SE is churning out aircraft at a rapid clip in the final days of the year, with confidence building at the European planemaker that it can achieve the delivery goal it was forced to cut only a few weeks ago, according to people familiar with the situation.
fullText: MarketsBy Siddharth PhilipSaveAirbus SE is churning out aircraft at a rapid clip in the final days of the year, with confidence building at the European planemaker that it can achieve the delivery goal it was forced to cut only a few weeks ago, according to people familiar with the situation. The company has delivered about 90 civil aircraft so far in December, with another 35 or so earmarked for delivery, meaning they have completed customer acceptance flights, said one of the people, who asked not to be identified because the figures aren‚Äôt public. Another person said management has no indication at this point that it might need to reduce its target again.

title: Slopes Are Empty as a Labor Dispute Shuts Down Telluride Colo
description: Now, vacationers looking to ski are wondering what to do and merchants are hoping it doesn‚Äôt last.
fullText:
The ski runs above the mountain town of Telluride, Colo., sat eerily empty on Saturday. Chair lifts hung as motionless as icicles. Tourists slumped beside outdoor fire pits, trying not to think about the money they had spent on ski vacations now upended by a labor dispute.

‚ÄúThis is the first time I‚Äôve seen snow in six years,‚Äù Alexander Caro, 23, who flew in from Miami with his family, said as he looked hungrily at the base of the ski mountain, now blocked off by ‚Äúclosed‚Äù signs.

A few feet away, a golden Labrador retriever played fetch in the snow beside the resort‚Äôs shuttered main lift. It was the closest anyone would get to having fun on the mountain this holiday weekend, after the resort decided to shut down its operations in response to a vote by the ski patrollers‚Äô union to reject a contract offer and go on strike for higher pay.

The resort and its owner, Chuck Horning, a real-estate investor based in California, blamed the patrollers for the shutdown. In an open letter, Mr. Horning accused the patrol union of rejecting what he called ‚Äúindustry-leading, livable and sustainable‚Äù pay increases that would have raised the starting pay for patrollers to about $24 an hour.

Graham Hoffman, the president of the 78-member Telluride Professional Ski Patrol Association, said the union had already come down from its initial demand of an increase of $8 per hour.

The current average pay for a ski patroller is $29 an hour, according to the union. The ski patrol provides medical assistance to skiers and guidance on the mountain, and helps to reduce the likelihood of avalanches. Patrollers say it is demanding and sometimes dangerous work, its perils highlighted by a recent avalanche at Mammoth Mountain that caught two patrollers.

Mr. Hoffman said the resort deserved the blame for the economic damage that might come from stopping the lifts.

‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt shut the mountain down,‚Äù he told several dozen ski patrollers in red jackets on Saturday morning, as they prepared to picket beside the gondola that connects the old mining town of Telluride to the slopes and the neighboring chalet-style town of Mountain Village.

The towns are scrambling to give visitors something to do by lighting fire pits and setting up ice-sculpting events and children‚Äôs play areas, or urging them to go hiking or snowmobiling. Local officials say there has not yet been a flood of cancellations. But they worry that few visitors will be willing to spend $10,000 on a winter trip to Telluride if the mountain stays closed.

‚ÄúThey came out to ski,‚Äù Mayor Teddy Errico of Telluride said.

The clash between the ski patrol union and its wealthy out-of-town owner has intensified the debate over the chasm between the superrich and everyone else in gilded resort towns like Telluride, where the median home price has soared to nearly $4 million since the pandemic. Many workers have been priced out of Telluride and, unable to find subsidized housing, have little choice but to commute an hour along treacherous mountain roads.

Tom Sokolowski, who at 80 years old is one of Telluride‚Äôs oldest and longest-serving ski patrollers, said he got his start on the mountain in the early 1970s, long before the Four Seasons began selling $7 million ‚Äúprivate residences‚Äù or restaurants served $150 Tomahawk steak dinners. Back then, Telluride was still a dwindling old mining town in the remote San Juan Mountains of southwestern Colorado.

He said he never paid more than $150 in rent ‚Äî a far cry from the $1,500 a month that some newcomers now pay to rent a room.

But Mr. Sokolowski said it was never easy to cobble together a living in a tourism-dependent town like Telluride, even before the likes of Oprah Winfrey and Tom Cruise began snapping up real estate. Because the ski season runs from late November through April, most patrollers are considered seasonal workers who do not receive health insurance. Many spend the off-season working construction and maintenance jobs, or as mountain guides or in restaurants.

‚ÄúThe ski bum life is almost done,‚Äù Mr. Sokolowski said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why we‚Äôre doing this.‚Äù

Tensions between workers and industry have roiled Telluride ever since its early mining days. In the early 1900s, gold and silver miners struck for minimum wages and better working conditions. But when the mining company brought in replacement workers, the strike spiraled into what newspapers called ‚Äúa bloody riot.‚Äù

This time, many who live in overwhelmingly liberal Telluride ‚Äî population 2,500, where utility boxes are plastered with ‚ÄúEliminate Billionaires‚Äù stickers ‚Äî say they support the ski patrol. As the patrollers marched down the main street on Saturday, snowy peaks towering above them, bus drivers and chauffeurs for luxury rental services honked in support.

Mr. Horning makes for an easy villain around Telluride. Local officials call him an absentee owner who has erratically cycled through ski-area managers, including, local officials said, firing his own son, and picked fights over funding the free gondola service and a summer-concert series. Local leaders openly call for him to sell the ski area, and an anonymous internet campaign has even cropped up to ‚Äúchuck Chuck.‚Äù

‚ÄúWe have an owner who‚Äôs unwilling to invest in his own company, his own resort, his own employees,‚Äù Paul Wisor, the town manager of the Mountain Village, said in an interview.

Nancy Clark, a spokeswoman for the ski resort, said the area was working on contingency plans that would allow it to reopen at least some of the mountain. She criticized the personal attacks against Mr. Horning as ‚Äúover the top.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhether people like Chuck or not, what they may not realize is that their extreme nastiness impacts everyone at the ski resort,‚Äù she said in an email. ‚ÄúWhen people attack Chuck, they are indirectly attacking every single person who works at that resort.‚Äù

The strike and shutdown come during a bleak start to the winter for much of the Mountain West. Snow levels in Colorado are tied for the worst on record, and mountainsides around Telluride that would normally be gleaming white are brown and barren.

As a few meager flakes swirled on Saturday afternoon, Greg Shawcroft, 30, who runs a food cart in Mountain Village near the lift, was just hoping the snow would come and lifts would start spinning. He blamed Mr. Horning for the shutdown, but said his business could not afford much more pain.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm torn,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI want ski patrol to get what they deserve, but at what cost to the community?‚Äù

title: Meaning and possible origin of "the (dog's) bollocks" (2019)
description: UK, 1980s‚Äîthe very best‚Äîperhaps from ‚Äòit sticks out like a dog‚Äôs ballocks‚Äô, denoting something obvious, hence someone or something that sticks out from the rest
fullText:
The British-English slang phrase the dog‚Äôs bollocks, also the bollocks, means the very best, the acme of excellence.

(Remark: I have presented the origin of American-English synonyms such as the bee‚Äôs knees and the frog‚Äôs eyebrows in ‚Äúthe cat‚Äôs whiskers‚Äù, and all that jazz.)

The Oxford English Dictionary (3rd edition ‚Äì 2008) says that the bollocks is a shortening of the dog‚Äôs bollocks. However, since the latter phrase is attested in 1986, and the former in 1981, it is also possible that the bollocks actually predates the dog‚Äôs bollocks as a superlative.

The origin of this use of the dog‚Äôs bollocks/the bollocks is obscure. However, an explanation was given in Volume 1: A ‚Äì I of The New Partridge1 Dictionary of Slang and Unconventional English (Routledge, 2006), by Tom Dalzell and Terry Victor:

dog‚Äôs bollocks; dog‚Äôs ballocks; the bollocks noun

anything considered to be the finest, the most excellent, the best UK, 1989

Derived from the phrase ‚ÄòIt sticks out like a dog‚Äôs ballocks‚Äô2 said of something that the speaker considers obvious, hence the sense of ‚Äòsomeone or something that sticks out from the rest‚Äô.

The same edition mentioned the use of dog‚Äôs ballocks in a different sense:

dog‚Äôs ballocks noun

in typography, a colon dash (:‚Äî) UK, 1961

1 The New-Zealand born lexicographer Eric Honeywood Partridge (1894-1979) first published A Dictionary of Slang and Unconventional English in 1937.

2 In this respect, it is interesting to remark that the British-English phrase a racing dog‚Äôs bollocks, attested in 1988, denotes something that protrudes.

For the explanation given in The New Partridge Dictionary to be plausible, the phrase it sticks out like a dog‚Äôs ballocks must predate the use of the dog‚Äôs bollocks/the bollocks in the sense ‚Äòthe most excellent‚Äô. This is possible, because:

‚Äì the bollocks is attested in this sense in 1981, the dog‚Äôs bollocks in 1986;

‚Äì it sticks out like a dog‚Äôs ballocks is recorded in the 8th edition (Routledge, 1984) of Eric Partridge‚Äôs A Dictionary of Slang and Unconventional English, edited by Paul Beale‚Äîthis signifies that it sticks out like a dog‚Äôs ballocks predates the 8th edition by several years (Paul Beale goes as far as writing that it dates from ‚Äúca. 1920‚Äù, but without giving any attestation).

The following are the entries dog‚Äôs ballocks and dog‚Äôs prick in the 8th edition (Routledge, 1984) of Eric Partridge‚Äôs A Dictionary of Slang and Unconventional English, edited by Paul Beale‚Äîincidentally, dog‚Äôs prick is absent from the above-mentioned edition of The New Partridge Dictionary of Slang and Unconventional English:

dog‚Äôs ballocks. The typographical colon-dash (:‚Äî): C. 20. See dog‚Äôs prick.‚Äî2. Esp. in the phrase ‚ÄòIt sticks out like a dog‚Äôs ballocks‚Äô, said of something that the speaker considers is patently obvious: low: since ca. 1920.

[‚Ä¶]

dog‚Äôs prick. An exclamation mark: authors‚Äô and journalists‚Äô: C. 20.

In the 3rd edition (Routledge & Kegan Paul Ltd., 1949) of A Dictionary of Slang and Unconventional English, Eric Partridge had recorded dog‚Äôs ballocks only in the sense ‚Äòcolon-dash‚Äô:

dog‚Äôs ballocks. The typographical colon-dash (:‚Äî): C. 20. Cf. dog‚Äôs prick.

[‚Ä¶]

dog‚Äôs prick. An exclamation mark: authors‚Äô and journalists‚Äô: C. 20.

EARLIEST INSTANCE OF THE BOLLOCKS

The phrase the bollocks is first recorded as an expression of praise for the Yamaha TZ750 in the British magazine Super Bike of September 1981:

‚ÄúThe Absolute Bollocks‚Äù

When Superlatives Fail ‚Äì Get Crude

Exclusive: We test Britain‚Äôs only road-going TZ 750

EARLIEST INSTANCES OF THE DOG‚ÄôS BOLLOCKS

The earliest known occurrence of the dog‚Äôs bollocks is from‚Äîor related to‚Äîthe 1986 version of The Gambler, a musical by Peter Brewis, Bob Goody and Mel Smith, first staged at Hampstead Theatre, London, on 15th April of that year. The quotation in the 3rd edition of the Oxford English Dictionary is as follows:

in P. Brewis et al. Gambler (cassette tape sleeve notes): ‚ÄòThey are of the opinion that, when it comes to Italian opera, Pavarotti is the dog‚Äôs bollocks.‚Äô

And, in Kick the Bucket and Swing the Cat: The Balderdash & Piffle Collection of English Words, and their Curious Origins (BBC Books, 2008), Alex Games explains:

Peter Brewis [‚Ä¶] told us of a play he wrote called The Gambler (along with Mel Smith and Bob Goody) which includes the immortal line ‚Äòwhen it comes to Italian opera, Pavarotti is the dog‚Äôs bollocks‚Äô.

The phrase the dog‚Äôs bollocks then appeared as the title of the annual issue of the British comic magazine Viz for 1989:

ANOTHER HARD ONE

VIZ

THE DOG‚ÄôS BOLLOCKS

THE BEST OF ISSUES 26 TO 31

NOT SUITABLE FOR CHILDREN, OLD FARTS OR GUARDIANS OF PUBLIC MORALS

The Liverpool Echo (Liverpool, Lancashire, England) mentioned that annual issue of Viz on Saturday 16th December 1989:

Top Ten on Merseyside

‚Ä¢B‚Ä¢O‚Ä¢O‚Ä¢K‚Ä¢S‚Ä¢

1, The Greatest Batman Stories Ever Told, 2. The Pocket Wine Guide, Hugh Johnson, 3. Red Dwarf, Grant Naylor, 4. The Dogs [sic] Bollocks, VIZ Comic, 5. Bygone Merseyside, Derek Whale, 6. The Book Of Crap Jokes, VIZ Comic, 7. Demon Lord Of Karanda, David Eddings, 8. Delia Smith‚Äôs Complete Illustrated Cookery, 9, The Ginger Tree. Oswald Wynd, 10, Foucault‚Äôs Pendulum. Umberto Eco,

The earliest occurrence of the dog‚Äôs bollocks that I have found is from Desert rations keep the rats happy in Mandalay Drive, by David Sharrock, published in The Guardian (London and Manchester, England) of Friday 7th December 1990‚Äîthe author reported from a British base somewhere in the eastern Arabian desert:

An invitation to lunch with the ‚ÄúLowland Gunners,‚Äù 40 Field Regiment, was how the Desert Rats intended to dispel a few hoary old myths about army chow.

Maybe it was something they put in the ill-famed compo rations, upon which the press stuffed themselves yesterday, but some of the 1,030 members of the Royal Artillery were enthusing about their new habitat.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the dog‚Äôs bollocks,‚Äù grinned Gunner Mark Sparrow, aged 20, from Swindon. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs great, this is what I joined up for. I like everything about it, the weather, the sense of urgency.‚Äù
